title: Explore UIC | UIC Admissions
text: When you come to UIC, you’ll learn from faculty engaged in cutting-edge research and work alongside talented, driven students. You’ll meet people from all over the world and be part of a diverse, forward-thinking community that strives for achievement—and values giving back. You’ll experience life in the heart of the city. Join clubs. Find internships. You’ll discover your passion—and your purpose.
No matter what you accomplish, an innovative, research-driven education from UIC will inspire you to aim high, think deeply and look forward to a future with limitless possibilities.
We guarantee you’ll find something that interests you among UIC's hundreds of organizations, sports clubs and more.

More than 50 percent of our freshmen live in our residence halls, and statistics show these students are more likely to graduate—and in less time. But you don’t need to live on campus. Off-campus housing options and on-campus resources for commuters are available.
You’ll find plenty of action at UIC, both as a spectator and a participant.
Discover what it’s like to live and study in the heart of a world-class city.
Get ready for amazing opportunities at UIC—for research, volunteering, internships, and learning among the nation’s top scholars and professors.
Want to make a difference in the world? People at UIC are doing it every day.
Almost half the first-year class lives on campus. Students are also guaranteed housing for as long as they're enrolled.

The Social Justice Initiative Student Summer Institute consists of a six-week course, an education and experiential learning program for ten UIC undergraduates focused on deepening their understanding of social justice issues in Chicago. Students read, discuss and collectively develop a social justice project that can educate and energize the larger community.
UIC is among the top 250 in the Times Higher Education World University Rankings.

Explore hundreds of student organizations through the Campus Programs office; deejay at UIC Radio; attend or help plan dozens of educational, cultural and fun campus events; and join a fraternity or sorority.
Fill your college experience with growth, learning and a lot of fun. Check out the Student Affairs website to learn how we can help make it happen.
UIC's Jane Addams Hull-House Museum consists of two of the original 13 buildings of one of the world's first social settlements.

An institution of growing national and international stature, UIC ranks 58th among American universities in federal research funding and 47th in funding from the National Institutes of Health. UIC is home to the nation’s largest college of medicine and five other health sciences colleges.

Taylor Street features classic Italian cuisine at dozens of restaurants both old and new. Don’t miss out on Italian ice from Mario’s Italian Lemonade. (Insider tip: It’s only open from May to September).
UIC has 15 academic colleges and offers 71 undergraduate majors and 60 undergraduate minors. Find out where you belong!
Land a great internship or your dream job after graduation with help from the Office of Career Services.
UIC’s Computer Science concentration in Human Centered Computing is recognized as a top 50 game design program by The Princeton Review.
That’s the value of a UIC degree over 20 years. The 2018 Payscale.com ROI Report ranks UIC in the top 11 percent of U.S. universities in annual return on investment.
Approximately 1,600 new transfer students join UIC every fall.
Your tuition rate will not increase while you are a UIC student for up to four years.
Our close proximity to downtown—and many top businesses and organizations—gives UIC students an advantage in finding internships.
Nearly two-thirds of UIC students received grants or scholarships last year. That’s money that you don’t need to repay.
Enhance your UIC academic experience. Students can apply for admission to the Honors College.
Times Higher Education and the Wall Street Journal have named UIC one of very best values in the U.S.—with particular strength in environment, engagement and outcomes.
Study at the University Library’s IDEA Commons, a student-centered space designed for collaborative study, technology use and research. It's open 24 hours a day, Sundays–Thursdays.
Top five sending countries include China, India, South Korea, Canada and Brazil.
Don’t forget to use UIC’s Financial Aid code: 001776
UIC is one of the top destinations for transfer students in the state. Nearly 40 percent of the UIC student body began their education somewhere else.
Many spaces feature gorgeous skyline views—another perk of being right in the heart of the city.
We educate some of the nation’s most sought-after nurses. UIC Nursing is ranked the 11th highest program in the nation by US News & World Report.
At UIC, you'll enjoy a student-to-faculty ratio of 19:1, and more than 3/4 of undergraduate courses are taught by tenured faculty.
Did you know that 1 in 10 Chicagoans with a college degree is a UIC graduate? Our alumni network is 200,000 strong!
Over one-third of our undergraduate students are multilingual with 57 different languages represented on campus.
Take a walk to see free public art on the Loop Art Tour featuring the Agora Sculpture in South Loop by Polish artist Magdalena Abakanowicz.

Chicago has more than 200 miles of on-street, protected, buffered and shared bike lanes. We also have a bike sharing program called DIVVY that allows students to rent bikes for short periods of time so they can get around the city. news.uic.edu/need-a-ride
International students have access to two major international airports, connected to campus by Chicago’s subway systems. It’s easy for UIC students to travel across the globe.
UIC’s Design program is ranked one of "The World’s 25 Best Design Schools” by Business Insider.
Chicago is the cultural and financial hub of the American Midwest, and the third largest city in the United States.
Women’s Basketball mounted the largest turnaround in the nation (with more than 17 wins) and claimed the postseason WBI Championship.
UIC is one of the top destinations for international students in the Midwest, and third in the state of Illinois.
UIC has a program that can guarantee admission to several professional programs, including law, pharmacy and physical therapy, to select first-year students. More information at gppa.uic.edu
Did you know that UIC is home to more than 5,000 trees, 469 solar panels, five green roofs and 800 bike racks?
Chicago is a national higher education destination. Over a quarter million students are enrolled in the city’s more than 50 colleges and universities. UIC is the largest university in Chicago.
Last year, more than 67 percent of students received some form of grant or scholarship aid.
A record-high 79 student-athletes were named to the Horizon League Honor Roll in 2017, earning a 3.5 GPA or higher.
UIC's Men’s Soccer won the 2017 Horizon League Regular Season Title for the first time since 2013.
All rooms come fully furnished and include all basic utilities, free laundry and 24-hour security measures.
UIC is the principal educator of health professionals in Illinois, and one of only four universities in the nation with a full complement of health science programs.
U.S. News & World Report named UIC one of the most diverse campuses in the United States, and Campus Pride ranks UIC among the nation’s top LGBT-friendly campuses.

Chicago, IL 60607-7161
